name: God
description: The divine creator of the heavens and the earth.

properties.significance: The supreme being who created the heavens and the earth and all living things, demonstrating omnipotence and sovereignty.

name: Spirit of God
description: The divine presence of God, active during creation.

properties.significance: The active force of God present during creation, hovering over the primordial waters, signifying divine involvement.

name: Heavens (Primordial)
description: The initial, undifferentiated celestial realm created by God.

properties.significance: One of the two primary realms created by God in the beginning, representing the celestial sphere.

name: Earth (Primordial)
description: The initial state of the planet, described as without form and void.

properties.significance: The initial, unformed state of the planet before God's creative acts, serving as the canvas for creation.

name: Deep
description: The primordial abyss or vast body of water.

properties.significance: The dark, formless abyss over which the Spirit of God hovered, representing the chaotic state before order.

name: Darkness
description: The state of absence of light covering the primordial deep.

properties.significance: The condition of the primordial earth before the creation of light, which God separated from light.

name: Expanse
description: The firmament or sky created to separate the waters above from the waters below.

properties.significance: The space created by God on the second day to establish a clear division between celestial and terrestrial waters.

name: Heaven (Sky)
description: The expanse above the earth, named by God on the second day.

properties.significance: The realm above the earth where birds fly and celestial bodies are later placed, providing a visible sky.

name: Dry Land
description: The landmasses that emerged from the gathered waters on the third day.

properties.significance: The solid ground that appeared after the waters were gathered, named Earth by God, providing a habitat for life.

name: Seas
description: The gathered bodies of water, named by God on the third day.

properties.significance: The large bodies of water gathered together, named Seas by God, which would later teem with aquatic life.

name: Sun
description: The greater light created on the fourth day to rule the day.

properties.significance: The primary light source for the day, created to rule over it and provide light and warmth to the earth.

name: Moon
description: The lesser light created on the fourth day to rule the night.

properties.significance: The secondary light source for the night, created to rule over it and provide light during darkness.

name: Stars
description: Celestial bodies created alongside the sun and moon on the fourth day.

properties.significance: Lesser lights set in the expanse of the heavens, contributing to the cosmic order and providing light.

name: Creation of the Universe
description: The overarching act of God bringing the heavens and the earth into existence.

properties.theological_significance: The foundational act demonstrating God's omnipotence and sovereignty as the sole creator of all existence, establishing the cosmos.

name: First Day of Creation
description: God creates light and separates it from darkness, establishing day and night.

properties.theological_significance: Marks the beginning of time and the introduction of light into the primordial darkness, bringing order from chaos.

name: Second Day of Creation
description: God creates the expanse (firmament) to separate the waters.

properties.theological_significance: Establishes the separation between the waters above and the waters below, forming the sky and creating a habitable atmosphere.

name: Third Day of Creation
description: God gathers the waters, reveals dry land, and creates vegetation.

properties.theological_significance: Forms the habitable earth and introduces plant life, providing sustenance and beauty to the world.

name: Fourth Day of Creation
description: God creates the sun, moon, and stars to govern day and night and mark seasons.

properties.theological_significance: Establishes celestial bodies for signs, seasons, days, and years, and to give light, demonstrating God's ordering of time and space.

name: Fifth Day of Creation
description: God creates aquatic life and birds, filling the waters and the sky with living creatures.

properties.theological_significance: Fills the waters and the sky with diverse living creatures, blessing them to be fruitful and multiply, showcasing God's abundance.

name: Sixth Day of Creation
description: God creates land animals and humanity in His own image.

properties.theological_significance: Culminates creation with the making of land animals and humanity in God's image, granting them dominion and signifying humanity's unique place.

name: Sea Creatures
description: All living creatures that swarm in the waters, created on the fifth day.

name: Birds
description: All winged creatures that fly above the earth, created on the fifth day.

name: Livestock
description: Domesticated animals created on the sixth day.

name: Creeping Things
description: Small animals that move along the ground, created on the sixth day.

name: Beasts of the Earth
description: Wild animals created on the sixth day.

name: Humanity
description: Male and female, created in God's image on the sixth day.
